The easiest way to get to Pewsey is by train. Pewsey Railway Station is on the Great Western main line. A one-way ticket from Paddington Station, London will cost approximately Â£27. The journey takes just over 1 hour.
Pewsey is close to the M4 Motorway and A303 making it relatively easy for driving to London, the
is a chalk figure located on a steep slope of Pewsey Hill about a mile south of the village and can be viewed from several places in the surrounding area.

Visit during the carnival activities every September (search for Pewsey Carnival for this year's itinerary). The highlights are a four-legged wine race, where teams of three wearing fancy dress race around the village to drink wine, a "wheel-beer-o" race where teams have spent the summer decorating a wheelbarrow and race to each pub for one drink before running through the river to a finish line, and the Carnival finale where thousands of people line the streets for an annual procession.
